meanings.definition: Defeated or overwhelmed in a conflict due to being outmatched in firepower.
meanings.sent1: The soldiers felt outgunned by the enemy's powerful weapons.
meanings.sent2: The team was clearly outgunned by their opponents in the match.
meanings.sent3: The outgunned troops tried to fight back with slingshots and water balloons.
meanings.sent4: In the battle of wits, he was always outgunned by his clever friend.
meanings.sent5: The outgunned ship faced the stormy sea with a tiny paddle.

meanings.definition: To surpass or exceed in firepower or weaponry.
meanings.sent1: The new tank design will outgunned all previous models.
meanings.sent2: The upgraded fighter jets will easily outgunned the enemy planes.
meanings.sent3: The hunters planned to outgunned the competition by using advanced rifles.
meanings.sent4: His determination to succeed will outgunned any obstacles in his way.
meanings.sent5: The chef's secret recipe will outgunned all other dishes at the competition.
